flawed_nl_solution:
The town had 684 people then had a 25% growth spurt increasing the population by 684*0.25 = 711 people
The town had 684 people then they added 711 people bringing the population to 684+711 = <<684+711=1395>>1395 people
There were 1395 people and 40% moved away so it decreased by 1395*0.4 = 558
The population was 1395 and 558 people moved away making the new population 1395-558 = <<1395-558=837>>837 people
#### 837

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 171, not 711. It appears two adjacent digits were swapped.
